User Story: As a player, I want to create a new campaign with a selected world and character so I can start a new story.
Acceptance Criteria:
Users can initiate the creation of a new campaign from the main interface
The system allows selection of a world and character for the campaign
Campaign creation stores basic metadata (name, world, character, creation date)
The new campaign appears in the campaign list immediately after creation
Users can begin play immediately after creating a campaign
Technical Requirements: The system must provide an interface for campaign creation. It must allow users to select from existing worlds and characters. The system must store campaign metadata (name, world, character, creation date) and display the new campaign in the campaign list immediately after creation.
Implementation Considerations: Consider the most intuitive flow for creating a new campaign. Think about what information is essential at creation time versus what could be set later. The interface should guide users through the process while preventing errors like creating campaigns without required elements.

User Story: As a player, I want to continue an existing campaign so I can resume my story where I left off.
Acceptance Criteria:
Existing campaigns are listed with basic metadata (name, world, character, last played)
Users can select a campaign to load its complete state
The system restores all state components (narrative, journal, character) correctly
Campaign state loads without significant delay
Play resumes from exactly where the user left off
Technical Requirements: The system must display a list of existing campaigns with relevant metadata. It must load the complete state of a selected campaign, including all components (narrative, journal, character) to allow resuming play exactly where the user left off. State restoration must be reliable and perform without significant delay.
Implementation Considerations: Consider how to present campaigns in a way that helps users identify the one they want to continue. Think about the loading experience and potential feedback during state restoration. The system should handle edge cases like corrupted save data or missing components gracefully.

User Story: As a player, I want to delete campaigns I'm no longer interested in so I can keep my campaign list organized.
Acceptance Criteria:
Users can initiate deletion of a campaign from the campaign list
The system requires confirmation before deleting a campaign
Deleted campaigns are completely removed from storage
The campaign list updates immediately after deletion
Deletion is permanent and cannot be undone
Technical Requirements: The system must allow users to delete campaigns they no longer want. It must require confirmation before completing deletion to prevent accidental data loss. The system must remove all campaign data including associated content (narrative sessions, journal entries, etc.) from storage.
Implementation Considerations: Consider the appropriate level of warning for a permanent deletion action. Think about the user flow to minimize accidental deletions while keeping the process straightforward. The system should provide clear feedback after deletion is complete.

User Story: As a player, I want my game state to automatically save during play so I don't lose progress if my browser crashes.
Acceptance Criteria:
The application state saves automatically every 5 minutes during active gameplay
State saves after significant events like player decisions or scene changes
Auto-save occurs without disrupting the player experience
Save operations properly handle large state objects
The system tracks the timestamp of the last successful save
Technical Requirements: The system must automatically save game state periodically and after significant events. Auto-save operations must not disrupt gameplay. The system must handle large state objects efficiently and track when saves occur. Save operations must be robust against errors.
Implementation Considerations: Consider the balance between save frequency and performance impact. Think about which events should trigger immediate saves. The save process should be optimized to handle varying sizes of state data without causing noticeable interruptions to the player experience.

User Story: As a player, I want to be notified when my game is saved so I know my progress is secure.
Acceptance Criteria:
A visual indicator confirms successful save operations
Save notifications are subtle and non-disruptive
Notifications appear briefly and disappear automatically
Notifications include basic information (e.g., "Game saved at 2:45 PM")
Notification styling matches the game's aesthetic
Technical Requirements: The system must provide visual confirmation when game state is successfully saved. These notifications must be subtle and non-disruptive to gameplay. They must appear briefly, include basic save information, and automatically disappear after a short time.
Implementation Considerations: Consider where and how save notifications should appear to be visible without being distracting. Think about appropriate timing for notification display and disappearance. The visual design should complement the game's aesthetic while clearly conveying the save status.
